context: "Tühja" is the translative case of "tühi" in Estonian, meaning "to become empty," "to make empty," or "into an empty state." It describes something that has been emptied out, made vacant, or transformed into a blank/empty condition. This form often appears with verbs indicating transformation (like 'laaditud' - loaded/emptied) or as part of expressions describing emptiness in containers, spaces, minds, etc.
